resources.string: Fitness-App
Select Level
LEVELS
ExpandAll >

Advance
Expert
Beginner
Chest
Biceps
Triceps
View >
Workout 1
Workout 2
Workout 3
Biceps Workout
1) Warm-up: Begin with a brief warm-up to increase blood flow to your muscles and prevent injuries.You can do some light cardio, such as jogging or jumping jacks, for about 5 minutes.

2) Standing Barbell or Dumbbell Curls: Stand with your feet shoulder–width apart, and hold a barbell or dumbbells with an underhand grip (palms facing upward). Curl the weight up towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your body. Slowly lower the weight back down. Aim for 3 sets of 10–12 repetitions.

3) Hammer Curls: Similar to standing curls, but this time, hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, and then lower them back down. Perform 3 sets of 10–12 repetitions.

4) Concentration Curls: Sit on a bench with your legs spread apart. Hold a dumbbell in one hand and place the back of your upper arm against your inner thigh. Curl the weight upward, focusing on contracting your biceps. Lower it back down. Do 3 sets of 10–12 repetitions per arm.
5) Rest: Take a short rest (about 1–2 minutes) between each set to allow your muscles to recover.
6) Cool Down: After completing the exercises, do some gentle stretching for your biceps and other major muscle groups involved in the workout.

1) Push-ups: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Start with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Lower your body until your chest almost touches the ground. ->Push back up to the starting position.

2) Dumbbell Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward. ->Lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest, keeping your elbows at 90 degrees. ->Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position.

3) Dumbbell Flyes: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. ->Lower the dumbbells out to your sides in a wide arc, feeling a stretch in your chest. ->Bring the dumbbells back up, squeezing your chest muscles.

4) Incline Push-ups: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Find an elevated surface (e.g., a bench or sturdy chair) and place your hands on it. ->Position yourself at an incline angle and perform push-ups. ->Lower your body and push back up.
5) Chest Stretch: Hold for 20-30 seconds ->Stand tall and clasp your hands behind your back. ->Straighten your arms and lift them slightly, feeling a stretch in your chest.

1) Shoulder Press (Dumbbell or Barbell): 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Sit or stand with your back straight and core engaged. ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level or use a barbell resting on your shoulders. ->Press the weights upward until your arms are fully extended overhead. ->Lower the weights back down to shoulder level.

2) Front Raises: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. ->Keeping your arms straight, raise the dumbbells to shoulder level, one at a time. ->Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.

3) Lateral Raises: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. ->Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells to the sides until they reach shoulder height. ->Lower the weights back down to your sides.

4) Bent-Over Raises (Rear Deltoid Raises): 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent. ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inwards towards your body. ->Raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the ground. ->Lower the weights back down with control.

5) Arnold Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Start with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing your body. ->As you press the dumbbells upward, rotate your palms to face forward. ->At the top of the movement, your arms should be fully extended and palms facing away from you. ->Reverse the motion and bring the dumbbells back to the starting position, rotating your palms back to the initial position.

6) Shoulder Stretch: Hold for 20-30 seconds on each arm ->Extend one arm across your chest. ->With your other hand, gently pull the extended arm closer to your body, feeling a stretch in your shoulder.

1) Tricep Dips (Assisted if needed): 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Find parallel bars or use the edge of a sturdy chair/bench. ->Lower your body by bending your elbows until they reach a 90-degree angle. ->Push back up to the starting position.

2) Dumbbell Tricep Extensions (Skull Crushers): 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended straight up. ->Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards your forehead (carefully). ->Extend your arms back up to the starting position.

3) Tricep Pushdowns (with resistance band or cable machine): 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Attach a resistance band or use a cable machine with a rope attachment. ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, and elbows at 90 degrees. ->Push the rope or band down, fully extending your arms. ->Slowly return to the starting position.

4) Overhead Dumbbell Extensions: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand or sit on a bench with a dumbbell in both hands. ->Raise the dumbbell overhead, keeping your upper arms close to your ears. ->Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows. ->Extend your arms back up to the starting position.

5) Tricep Stretch: Hold for 20-30 seconds on each arm ->Extend one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, reaching down your back. ->With your other hand, gently push on the bent elbow to deepen the stretch.

1) Bodyweight Rows (or Inverted Rows): 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Find a sturdy horizontal bar or use a Smith machine at waist height. ->Lie down underneath the bar and grasp it with an overhand grip. ->Keep your body in a straight line and pull your chest up towards the bar. ->Lower your body back down to the starting position.

2) Lat Pulldowns: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your knees positioned under the pads. ->Grab the bar with a wide overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Pull the bar down to your chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together. ->Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position.

3) Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm ->Place one knee and the same-side hand on a bench, keeping your back parallel to the ground. ->Hold a dumbbell in the other hand with your arm extended towards the ground. ->Pull the dumbbell up towards your torso, squeezing your back muscles. ->Lower the dumbbell back down and repeat on the other side.

4) Superman (Back Extensions): 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Lie face down on the ground with your arms extended in front of you. ->Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground simultaneously, engaging your lower back. ->Hold the top position for a moment, then lower back down.

5) Deadlifts (Romanian or Trap Bar): 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip. ->Hinge at your hips and lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping your back flat. ->Push through your heels and bring your torso back to an upright position.
6) Back Stretch: Hold for 20-30 seconds ->Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you. ->Reach forward with your arms, trying to touch your toes, and feel a stretch in your back.

1) Crunches: 3 sets of 15-20 reps ->Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. ->Place your hands behind your head, but avoid pulling on your neck. ->Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, curling towards your knees. ->Lower your upper back back down with control.

2) Leg Raises: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie flat on your back with your legs straight. ->Keep your hands by your sides or under your glutes for support. ->Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground until they form a 90-degree angle with your torso. ->Lower your legs back down slowly without touching the ground.

3) Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20-30 reps (10-15 each side) ->Lie on your back and place your hands behind your head. ->Lift your shoulders off the ground, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg straight. ->Alternate sides by bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while extending your left leg straight. ->Continue alternating in a "bicycling" motion.

4) Plank: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute each ->Get into a push-up position with your hands directly under your shoulders. ->Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, engaging your core. ->Hold the position, focusing on maintaining a stable and flat back.

5) Russian Twists: 3 sets of 20-30 reps (10-15 each side) ->Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. ->Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight and core engaged. ->Hold your hands together and twist your torso to the right, then to the left, tapping the ground beside you.

6) Reverse Crunches: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet off the ground. ->Place your hands on the floor beside you or under your glutes for support. ->Use your lower abs to lift your hips off the ground, curling them towards your chest. ->Lower your hips back down slowly without touching the ground.

1) Bodyweight Squats: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out. ->Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees, as if sitting back into a chair. ->Keep your chest up and your knees in line with your toes. ->Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

2) Lunges: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg ->Stand with your feet together. ->Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body until both knees are at 90-degree angles. ->Push through your front heel to return to the starting position. ->Alternate legs for each repetition.

3) Glute Bridges: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. ->Engage your core and push through your heels to lift your hips off the ground. ->Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement, then lower your hips back down.

4) Standing Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps
->Stand with your feet flat on the ground and hands on a wall or stable surface for support. ->Rise up onto the balls of your feet, lifting your heels as high as possible. ->Lower your heels back down to the starting position.

5) Step-ups: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg ->Find a stable step or elevated surface. ->Step one foot onto the step, pushing through your heel, and bring your other foot up. ->Step back down with the same foot, then alternate to the other leg.

6) Wall Sits: 3 sets, hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute each ->Stand with your back against a wall and slide down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle. ->Keep your back against the wall and hold the position, engaging your quads and core.

7) Seated Leg Curls (Machine or Resistance Band): 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Sit on a leg curl machine or the edge of a bench with a resistance band wrapped around your ankles. ->Curl your legs towards your glutes, engaging your hamstrings. ->Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

1) Barbell Bench Press: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground. ->Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Lower the barbell to your chest with control, then push it back up to the starting position.

2) Dumbbell Flyes: 4 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. ->Lower the dumbbells out to your sides in a wide arc, feeling a stretch in your chest. ->Bring the dumbbells back up to the starting position, squeezing your chest muscles.

3) Incline Dumbbell Press: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Set the bench to a 30-45 degree incline. ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie back on the bench. ->Lower the dumbbells to your shoulders, then press them up over your chest.

4) Cable Crossovers: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Set the cable machine at chest height with handles attached. ->Stand in the center, one foot in front of the other for stability. ->Cross one hand over the other in a hugging motion, feeling your chest muscles contract. ->Return to the starting position with control.

5) Push-Ups (Weighted if possible): 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Get into a standard push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Place a weight plate or a backpack filled with weights on your back. ->Lower your chest towards the ground, then push back up.

6) Chest Dips: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Use parallel bars or dip bars. ->Lower your body until your elbows are bent at 90 degrees or slightly below. ->Push back up to the starting position, focusing on your chest muscles.
7) Close Grip Bench Press: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with your hands closer together than in a regular bench press. ->Lower the barbell to your chest, then press it back up.

1) Barbell Bicep Curls: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip. ->Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

2) Alternating Dumbbell Curls: 4 sets of 10-12 reps per arm ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. ->Curl one dumbbell up towards your shoulder while keeping the other arm down. ->Lower the dumbbell back down and alternate arms.

3) Hammer Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). ->Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while keeping your palms facing inward throughout the movement. ->Lower the dumbbells back down with control.

4) Preacher Curls (with EZ bar or dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Sit on a preacher curl bench or use an incline bench with an EZ bar or dumbbells. ->Place your upper arms against the pad and curl the weight up towards your shoulders. ->Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner.

5) Concentration Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm ->Sit on a bench, holding a dumbbell in one hand. ->Rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh, letting the dumbbell hang down. ->Curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary. ->Lower the dumbbell back down with control.

6) Reverse Barbell Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down). ->Curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your sides. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

1) Close Grip Bench Press: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with your hands placed close together on the barbell (about shoulder-width apart). ->Lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. ->Push the barbell back up to the starting position.

2) Tricep Dips (Weighted if possible): 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Use parallel bars or dip bars. ->Lower your body until your elbows are bent at 90 degrees or slightly below. ->Push back up to the starting position, focusing on your triceps.

Overhead Tricep Extensions (with EZ bar or dumbbell): 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand or sit on a bench with a dumbbell in both hands or an EZ bar overhead. ->Lower the weight behind your head by bending your elbows. ->Extend your arms back up to the starting position.

4) Tricep Rope Pushdowns: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Attach a rope to the cable machine and set it to a high position. ->Stand facing the machine and grab the rope with both hands. ->Push the rope down until your arms are fully extended. ->Slowly release the rope back up, focusing on the tricep contraction.

5) Diamond Push-Ups: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Get into a push-up position with your hands close together, forming a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers. ->Lower your chest towards the diamond shape while keeping your elbows close to your body. ->Push back up to the starting position.

6) Tricep Kickbacks: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand and hinge forward at your hips. ->Keep your upper arms close to your body and extend your forearms back. ->Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement before lowering the dumbbells back down.

1) Seated Barbell Shoulder Press: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Sit on a bench with back support, holding a barbell at shoulder height. ->Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended. ->Lower the barbell back down to shoulder height with control.

2) Dumbbell Lateral Raises: 4 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. ->Lift the dumbbells out to your sides until they reach shoulder height. ->Lower the dumbbells back down with control.

3) Arnold Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Start with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing your body. ->As you press the dumbbells upward, rotate your palms to face forward. ->At the top of the movement, your arms should be fully extended, and palms facing away from you. ->Reverse the motion and bring the dumbbells back to the starting position, rotating your palms back to the initial position.

4) Bent-Over Reverse Flyes: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent. ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other. ->Raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the ground. ->Lower the dumbbells back down with control.

5) Upright Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip. ->Lift the barbell towards your chin, keeping it close to your body. ->Lower the barbell back down to your thighs with control.

6) Cable Face Pulls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Set the cable machine to shoulder height with a rope attachment. ->Stand facing the machine and grab the ropes with an overhand grip. ->Pull the ropes towards your face, squeezing your shoulder blades together. ->Slowly release the ropes back to the starting position.

1) Deadlifts: 4 sets of 6-8 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, and a barbell in front of you. ->Bend at your hips and knees to grip the barbell with an overhand grip. ->Keep your back flat and chest up as you lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

2) Pull-Ups or Chin-Ups: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Use a pull-up bar with an overhand grip for pull-ups or an underhand grip for chin-ups. ->Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. ->Lower yourself back down with control.

3) Bent Over Barbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and bend forward at the hips, keeping your back flat. ->Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Pull the barbell up towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

4) Seated Cable Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Sit at a cable machine with your knees slightly bent and feet against the footrests. ->Grasp the cable handles with an overhand grip. ->Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together. ->Extend your arms back out with control.

5) Dumbbell Pullovers: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie on a bench with your head and upper back supported. ->Hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest, arms extended. ->Lower the dumbbell behind your head until you feel a stretch in your lats. ->Raise the dumbbell back to the starting position.

6) T-Bar Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Place one end of a barbell into a landmine attachment or corner of a room. ->Load the other end with weight plates. ->Straddle the barbell and bend at your hips to grip it with both hands. ->Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your back muscles. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

1) Hanging Leg Raises: 4 sets of 10-12 reps ->Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms extended and your legs straight. ->Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the ceiling, avoiding swinging. ->Lower your legs back down with control.

2) Russian Twists (with weight): 4 sets of 20-25 reps (10-12 each side) ->Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. ->Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight and core engaged. ->Hold a weight or medicine ball with both hands and rotate your torso from side to side.

3) Cable Crunches: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Kneel in front of a cable machine with the rope attachment overhead. ->Hold the rope with both hands and bring it down towards your knees by flexing your abs. ->Slowly return to the starting position.

4) Plank with Shoulder Taps: 3 sets of 12-15 taps per side ->Get into a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and feet hip-width apart. ->While maintaining a stable core, tap your right hand to your left shoulder. ->Return to the plank position and then tap your left hand to your right shoulder.

5) Bicycle Crunches: 3 sets of 20-30 reps (10-15 each side) ->Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and legs lifted off the ground. ->Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg. ->Alternate sides by bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while extending your left leg.

6) Swiss Ball Rollouts: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Kneel in front of a Swiss ball with your hands resting on the ball. ->Roll the ball away from you by extending your arms, keeping your core tight. ->Roll the ball back towards you to the starting position.

7) Dragon Flags: 3 sets of 6-8 reps ->Lie on a flat bench and hold onto the edges with both hands. ->Lift your legs and lower back off the bench, keeping your body in a straight line. ->Slowly lower your legs towards the ground, engaging your abs to control the movement. ->Use your core to lift your legs back to the starting position.

1) Back Squats: 4 sets of 6-8 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting on your upper back. ->Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees, as if sitting back into a chair. ->Keep your chest up and knees in line with your toes. ->Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

2) Romanian Deadlifts: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart. ->Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a slight bend in your knees. ->Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat, lowering the barbell towards the ground. ->Engage your hamstrings and glutes to bring your torso back to an upright position.

3) Bulgarian Split Squats: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per leg ->Stand facing away from a bench or elevated surface. ->Place one foot on the bench behind you and the other foot firmly on the ground. ->Lower your body into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee stays in line with your toes. ->Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.

4) Leg Press: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Sit on a leg press machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. ->Lower the platform towards your chest by bending your knees. ->Push the platform back up to the starting position.

5) Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 12-15 steps per leg ->Stand with your feet together. ->Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body into a lunge position. ->Push off your front foot to bring your back foot forward into the next lunge. ->Continue walking lunges for the desired number of steps.

6) Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart on the edge of a step or platform. ->Rise up onto the balls of your feet, lifting your heels as high as possible. ->Lower your heels back down to the starting position.

1) Barbell Bench Press: 5 sets of 5 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground. ->Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Lower the barbell to your chest, then press it back up explosively. ->Use challenging weights for each set.

2) Incline Dumbbell Bench Press: 4 sets of 6-8 reps ->Set an adjustable bench to a 30-45 degree incline. ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level. ->Lower the dumbbells to your shoulders, then press them up powerfully.

3) Dips (Weighted if possible): 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Use parallel bars or dip bars. ->Lower your body until your elbows are bent at 90 degrees or slightly below. ->Push back up explosively to the starting position.

4) Cable Crossovers: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Set the cable machine at chest height with handles attached. ->Stand in the center, one foot in front of the other for stability. ->Cross one hand over the other in a hugging motion, feeling your chest muscles contract. ->Return to the starting position with control.

5) Dumbbell Flyes: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. ->Lower the dumbbells out to your sides in a wide arc, feeling a stretch in your chest. ->Bring the dumbbells back up to the starting position, squeezing your chest muscles.

6) Push-Ups (Weighted if possible): 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Get into a standard push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Place a weight plate or a weighted vest on your back. ->Lower your chest towards the ground, then push back up powerfully.

7) Plyometric Push-Ups: 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Get into a standard push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Lower your chest towards the ground, then explosively push off the ground to lift your hands off momentarily. ->Land softly and immediately go into the next repetition.

1) Barbell Bicep Curls (With Cheat Reps): 5 sets of 6-8 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip. ->Keep your elbows slightly forward and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders. ->For the last 1-2 reps of each set, you can use controlled "cheat reps" to lift the weight with a bit of momentum to further challenge the muscles.

2) Alternate Dumbbell Hammer Curls: 4 sets of 8-10 reps per arm ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). ->Curl one dumbbell up towards your shoulder while keeping the other arm down. ->Alternate arms with each repetition.

3) Preacher Curls (with EZ bar or dumbbells): 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Sit on a preacher curl bench or use an incline bench with an EZ bar or dumbbells. ->Place your upper arms against the pad and curl the weight up towards your shoulders. ->Focus on squeezing the biceps at the top of the movement.

4) Concentration Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm ->Sit on a bench, holding a dumbbell in one hand. ->Rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh, letting the dumbbell hang down. ->Curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary. ->Lower the dumbbell back down with control.

5) Spider Curls: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Lie face down on an incline bench, with your chest and stomach supported. ->Allow your arms to hang straight down and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders. ->This exercise emphasizes the long head of the biceps.

6) Cable Bicep Curls (With Drop Sets): 3 sets of 8-10 reps (each arm) ->Set the cable machine with a straight bar or rope attachment at the bottom position. ->Perform regular cable curls with challenging weight for 8-10 reps per arm. ->Immediately after completing the set, lower the weight and perform 8-10 more reps per arm with lighter resistance.

1) Close Grip Bench Press: 5 sets of 5 reps ->Lie flat on a bench with your hands placed close together on the barbell (about shoulder-width apart). ->Lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. ->Push the barbell back up explosively to the starting position.

2) Weighted Dips: 4 sets of 6-8 reps ->Use parallel bars or dip bars. ->Attach a weight belt or use a weighted vest for added resistance. ->Lower your body until your elbows are bent at 90 degrees or slightly below. ->Push back up powerfully to the starting position.

Skull Crushers (Lying Triceps Extensions): 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Lie on a flat bench with a barbell or EZ bar extended over your chest. ->Lower the weight towards your forehead by bending your elbows. ->Press the weight back up, extending your arms fully.

4) Tricep Rope Pushdowns (With Drop Sets): 3 sets of 8-10 reps ->Set the cable machine with a rope attachment at the high position. ->Perform tricep pushdowns with challenging weight for 8-10 reps. ->Immediately after completing the set, lower the weight and perform 8-10 more reps with lighter resistance.

5) Overhead Dumbbell Tricep Extension: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand or sit on a bench with a dumbbell in both hands overhead. ->Lower the dumbbell behind your head, bending your elbows. ->Extend your arms back up to the starting position.

6) Diamond Push-Ups: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Get into a push-up position with your hands close together, forming a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers. ->Lower your chest towards the diamond shape while keeping your elbows close to your body. ->Push back up powerfully to the starting position.
7) Tricep Dips (Bodyweight): Burnout set ->Use parallel bars or dip bars. ->Perform as many bodyweight dips as possible until you reach muscle failure.

1) Barbell Overhead Press: 5 sets of 5 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting on your upper chest with an overhand grip. ->Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended. ->Lower the barbell back down to your upper chest with control.

2) Arnold Press: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Start with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing your body. ->As you press the dumbbells upward, rotate your palms to face forward. ->At the top of the movement, your arms should be fully extended, and palms facing away from you. ->Reverse the motion and bring the dumbbells back to shoulder height, rotating your palms back to the initial position.

3) Lateral Raises (With Drop Sets): 4 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides. ->Raise the dumbbells out to your sides until they reach shoulder height. ->Immediately after completing the set, lower the weight and perform 8-10 more reps with lighter dumbbells.

4) Bent Over Dumbbell Reverse Flyes: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back flat and knees slightly bent. ->Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other. ->Raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the ground. ->Lower the dumbbells back down with control.

5) Upright Rows (With EZ bar or Dumbbells): 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar or dumbbells with an overhand grip. ->Lift the barbell or dumbbells towards your chin, keeping them close to your body. ->Lower the barbell or dumbbells back down to your thighs with control.

6) Face Pulls: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Set the cable machine to shoulder height with a rope attachment. ->Stand facing the machine and grab the ropes with an overhand grip. ->Pull the ropes towards your face, squeezing your shoulder blades together. ->Slowly release the ropes back to the starting position.

1) Deadlifts: 5 sets of 5 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell on the ground in front of you. ->Bend at your hips and knees to grip the barbell with an overhand grip. ->Keep your back flat and chest up as you lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees. ->Lower the barbell back down to the ground with control.

2) Pull-Ups or Chin-Ups: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Use a pull-up bar with an overhand grip for pull-ups or an underhand grip for chin-ups. ->Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. ->Lower yourself back down with control.

3) Bent Over Barbell Rows: 4 sets of 8-10 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and bend forward at the hips, keeping your back flat. ->Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. ->Pull the barbell up towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

4) T-Bar Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Place one end of a barbell into a landmine attachment or corner of a room. ->Load the other end with weight plates. ->Straddle the barbell and bend at your hips to grip it with both hands. ->Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your back muscles. ->Lower the barbell back down with control.

5) Single-Arm Dumbbell Rows: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per arm ->Place your left knee and left hand on a flat bench, keeping your back parallel to the ground. ->Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your arm fully extended. ->Pull the dumbbell up towards your torso, squeezing your back muscles. ->Lower the dumbbell back down with control and repeat on the other side.

6) Hyperextensions: 3 sets of 12-15 reps ->Lie face down on a hyperextension bench with your hips just over the edge. ->Cross your arms over your chest and lower your upper body towards the ground. ->Lift your upper body back up, engaging your lower back muscles.

1) Hanging Leg Raises: 4 sets of 10-12 reps ->Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended. ->Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the ceiling, avoiding swinging. ->Lower your legs back down with control.

2) Dragon Flags: 4 sets of 6-8 reps ->Lie on a flat bench and hold onto the edges with both hands. ->Lift your legs and lower back off the bench, keeping your body in a straight line. ->Slowly lower your legs towards the ground, engaging your abs to control the movement. ->Use your core to lift your legs back to the starting position.

3) Cable Woodchoppers: 3 sets of 10-12 reps per side ->Set the cable machine to a high position with a rope or handle attachment. ->Stand with your side facing the machine and grab the handle with both hands. ->Pull the handle diagonally across your body and down towards your opposite hip, rotating your torso. ->Slowly return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

4) Swiss Ball Rollouts: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Kneel in front of a Swiss ball with your hands resting on the ball. ->Roll the ball away from you by extending your arms, keeping your core tight. ->Roll the ball back towards you to the starting position.

5) Russian Twists (with weight): 3 sets of 20-25 reps (10-12 each side) ->Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. ->Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight and core engaged. ->Hold a weight or medicine ball with both hands and rotate your torso from side to side.

6) Plank to Pike: 3 sets of 10-12 reps ->Start in a plank position with your forearms on the ground. ->Push your hips up towards the ceiling, forming an inverted V shape with your body. ->Return to the plank position and repeat.

1) Barbell Back Squats: 5 sets of 5 reps ->Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell on your upper back. ->Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees, as if sitting back into a chair. ->Keep your chest up and knees in line with your toes. ->Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

2) Romanian Deadlifts: 4 sets of 8 reps ->Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart. ->Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a slight bend in your knees. ->Hinge at your hips while keeping your back flat, lowering the barbell towards the ground. ->Engage your hamstrings and glutes to bring your torso back to an upright position.

3) Bulgarian Split Squats: 4 sets of 10 reps per leg ->Stand facing away from a bench or elevated surface. ->Place one foot on the bench behind you and the other foot firmly on the ground. ->Lower your body into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee stays in line with your toes. ->Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.

4) Leg Press: 3 sets of 12 reps ->Sit on a leg press machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. ->Lower the platform towards your chest by bending your knees. ->Push the platform back up to the starting position.

5) Walking Lunges: 3 sets of 12 steps per leg ->Stand with your feet together. ->Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body into a lunge position. ->Push off your front foot to bring your back foot forward into the next lunge. ->Continue walking lunges for the desired number of steps.
6) Seated Calf Raises: 3 sets of 15-20 reps ->Sit on a calf raise machine with your knees bent and feet against the footrests. ->Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower them back down.

7) Sled Push or Sled Pull: 3 sets ->Load a sled with weights and either push it for a set distance or attach a harness and pull it backward for a set distance. ->This exercise engages various leg muscles while providing a great cardio and strength challenge.

1) Caloric Surplus: To gain weight, you need to consume more calories than your body burns. Calculate your daily caloric needs using an online calculator and aim to consume around 300-500 calories above that number.

2) Macronutrients Balance: Proteins: They are essential for muscle repair and growth. Aim for about 1.2 to 1.5 grams of protein per pound of body weight. Good sources include chicken, turkey, lean beef, fish, eggs, dairy, legumes, and tofu. Carbohydrates: These provide energy for workouts and daily activities. Choose complex carbohydrates like whole grains, brown rice, quinoa, sweet potatoes, oats, and fruits. Fats: Healthy fats are calorie-dense and beneficial for overall health. Incorporate sources like avocados, nuts, seeds, olive oil, and fatty fish.
3) Regular Meals and Snacks: Aim to eat 3 main meals and 2-3 snacks between them throughout the day. This helps increase calorie intake.
4) Protein-rich Breakfast: Start your day with a protein-rich breakfast. It could be eggs, Greek yogurt with nuts and fruits, or a protein smoothie.
5) Frequent Protein Snacks: Have protein-rich snacks such as nuts, Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, protein bars, or a protein shake between meals.
6) Healthy Fats: Include sources of healthy fats in your meals, like avocados, nuts, seeds, and olive oil.
7) Weight-Gaining Smoothies: Blend together fruits, Greek yogurt, milk, protein powder, and nut butter for a calorie-dense and nutritious smoothie.
8) Starchy Vegetables: Include starchy vegetables like sweet potatoes, peas, corn, and squash in your meals.
9) Strength Training: Combine your diet plan with a proper strength training routine to stimulate muscle growth.
10) Hydration: Stay hydrated throughout the day. Water is crucial for various bodily functions.
11) Avoid Empty Calories: While it\'s essential to increase calorie intake, avoid relying on sugary and processed foods with empty calories. Focus on nutrient-rich choices.
12) Rest and Recovery: Ensure you get enough sleep and rest to support muscle recovery and overall well-being.
1) Calculate Caloric Needs: Use an online calculator to estimate your daily caloric needs. Then, create a calorie deficit by consuming 300-500 calories less than your daily requirement.
2) Portion Control: Pay attention to portion sizes to avoid overeating. Use smaller plates and bowls to help with portion control.

3) Balanced Macronutrients: Proteins: Include lean protein sources like chicken, turkey, fish, tofu, beans, and legumes. Protein helps you feel full and preserves muscle mass during weight loss. Complex Carbohydrates: Opt for whole grains, brown rice, quinoa, oats, fruits, and vegetables. These provide sustained energy and fiber, which aids digestion. Healthy Fats: Incorporate sources like avocados, nuts, seeds, olive oil, and fatty fish. Healthy fats are essential for various bodily functions.
4) Vegetables and Fruits: Load up on non-starchy vegetables and fruits, which are low in calories and high in nutrients. They also provide essential vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
5) Limit Added Sugars and Processed Foods: Minimize sugary beverages, candies, pastries, and processed snacks, as they are calorie-dense but nutrient-poor.
6) Regular Meals and Snacks: Don\'t skip meals and aim for 3 main meals and 1-2 healthy snacks per day. Eating regularly helps maintain stable blood sugar levels and prevents overeating.
7) Hydration: Drink plenty of water throughout the day. Sometimes, thirst can be mistaken for hunger.
8) Mindful Eating: Pay attention to your hunger and fullness cues. Avoid distractions while eating and savor your meals.
9) Limit Liquid Calories: Be cautious with high-calorie beverages like sodas, sugary juices, and alcoholic drinks. Opt for water, herbal teas, or flavored water with no added sugars.
10) Cook at Home: Preparing meals at home allows you to control ingredients and portion sizes better.
11) Stay Active: Regular physical activity is crucial for weight loss. Incorporate both cardiovascular exercises and strength training into your routine.
12) Monitor Progress: Keep track of your food intake and exercise to stay accountable and make adjustments as needed.
